column1: full and straight, gives himself room and drills it to mid-on
full, swinging back in, clipped to midwicket
length, gives himself room, still didn't have enough width for the cut shot, hit him high on the bat due to the extra bounce in Perth and spooned straight to point
full on off, squeezed away to third man

full and swinging back in and he has stuck him on the pad as Klinger misses the flick. Played all around it and given immediately by the umpire. But it was missing leg, the replays suggest and what more it pitched outside leg
full and swinging back in again, but missing leg, deflected off the pad for a single
length on off, extra bounce, pokes at it tentatively and beaten
length outside off, let through
length on off, nipping back in to the right hander, defended with soft hands
full and wide, edged to third man for their first four of the evening
full outside off, beaten on the drive, stifled appeal but the sound was the bat hitting the ground
and that's another one for Faulkner. Gave himself room, the swing back in followed him and cramped him for room, on to the pad and deflected on to the stumps
full and straight, not as much swing and driven down the ground for the most convincing stroke of the evening so far
full on middle, bit of swing back again, thick inside edge down to fine leg
full on off, moving away a touch, driven square but straight to the fielder
length outside off, coming into the left hander who skipped down the wicket and was struck on the pads outside the line
full toss on leg stump, misses the flick
length on off, pushed to mid-off and they scamper through for one
full outside off, driven square again but they have a tight field there, straight to cover-point
full outside off, driven through the covers, it was aerial and not perfectly timed but in the gap and races away
full on leg and he has picked that up off his legs and launched it over fine-leg using the pace of the bowler
full toss, driven to cover, they get through for one
length, angled in and he has picked that over square leg this time, carries over the fence
full and swinging away, makes room but too much room and beaten
length on off, away ,movement and beaten on the drive
length outside off, flashes and edges it down to third man
length on middle, swinging back in, punched to midwicket
full on off, pushed to mid-off and a quick run stolen
full on off, pushes at it and gets an inside edge to squareleg
full on the pads and he has flicked that for six over deep midwicket this time. Bit of Sanath Jayasuriya in that
length on middle, defended awkwardly. That was over 147kmph
short ball, angled across, the batsman got across but missed the ramp. called wide
short one, left alone, too high again, called a no ball, which means it's a free hit
length ball, angling in and has swatted that to the right of fine leg
full toss, driven hard, but straight to cover-point
slower ball, full toss, cleverly steered behind but the keeper latches on with a dive. However, it's no ball for height
slower ball on a length, swings and misses as he is too early into the shot
full toss, down the wicket, drilled to long-on
length on middle, reverse swept to short-fine
full on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
down the wicket, Botha sees him come and bowls it wide, deceives him in the air, but he manages to reach it and push it to long-off
full and drilled back to the bowler
length on off, turned around to squareleg
length ball, and through him. Beat him for pace
length on middle, pushed to mid-on
length on off, steered to third-man
length on off, straightened a little and squared him up but gets an outside edge to third-man
slower ball and that's gone horribly wrong, it was wide and way above the waist, clearly slipped out but Archer is being taken off the attack for the second one over the waist
length on middle, pulled away, top edge, taken at fine leg but it was a free hit
length on off, pushed to point
full on off, skips down and pushes it to cover
length on off, skips down and drags it to long-on
length on the legs, he comes down the wicket and launches him over long-on for a massive six
full and wide of off, driven to the left of long-off that allows them to come through for a couple
length on middle, tuned around with soft hands to midwicket, and with nobody in the circle they scamper through for two
length on the pads, skips down the track again and places it nicely to the right of long-on for another well run two
full outside off, driven to long-off
length on middle, skips down the wicket and pushes it to deep midwicket
length outside off, pushed to long-off
length, way outside leg, Whiteman taps it on the head and gets a boundary
slower, outside off, lofts it over the infield
length on middle, defended back
length on middle, cramping him up, but pushed past the bowler for one
yorker on middle, digs it out
length outside off, steered aerially to third man
length on middle, drilled to mid-on
length on middle, pulled to deep midwicket
full and swept hard
slower, length on middle, swings at it wildly and manages an inside edge to short fine
down the wicket and walks past a well pitched googly. He was stumped but may have got an outside edge before that
length on off, squeezed to short fine off the inside edge
full outside off, driven to deep cover and that's a brilliant fifty for Whiteman
full, pushed back to the bowler
full and on the pads, nicely glanced down to fine leg
length and on the pads again but clipped straight to fine leg this time
on the pads of the left hander this time, flicked to deep midwicket
length, misses his line again, down the leg side and called wide
length, angled in, defended off the backfoot with soft hands
length on the pads again, can't connect with the pick up shot for once, the deflection off the thigh pad earns a single
length on middle, premeditated sweep but in the gap between deep midwicket and squareleg
full on off, lofted over the bowlers head, not perfectly times and just over the outstretched fingers of Archer at long-off
length outside leg and helps it down to fine leg
length on middle, clipped to deep midwicket
googly, outside leg, swept fine but doesn't get a lot of it
skips down, sees him coming, speared down the legside but Whiteman has the presence of mind to adjust and push it to deep squareleg

length on leg, swings and misses, they try and get through for a leg bye but the bowler was quicker to it and hurled a throw back to the non striker's end and hit directly to find a diving Hardie well short
length on middle, inside edge to fine leg
length, slower ball, down the leg side
length, angled in, pushed to squareleg with soft hands that allows them to come through for two
full and straight, drilled down the ground but can't beat mid-off
length on the legs, he has picked it up but found fine leg
edged and taken. Moody has two in two. It was length outside off, the batsman threw his hands at it and got a healthy edge to the keeper. Three wickets in that over
full outside off, beaten on the drive
length on middle, pushed to squareleg
length on middle, drilled to long-on
length on middle, swung away but can't get enough
length on middle, slower and he has launched that over deep midwicket for a massive six
full toss on the pads, clipped to fine-leg
full and straight, drilled to mid-off
slower ball on middle, swung away to the leg side, gets a single to fine-leg
length outside off and he has smashed that between cover and mid-off
bouncer, misses the pull, one for the over
yorker on off, squeezed to squareleg
pitched, drifting in, clipped off the pads and timed beautifully
length on middle, pulled hard, it's a bit of a top edge but sails over fine-leg
length on off, swings wildly, hits him high on the bat, spoons between point and cover but the fielder couldn't get there
full and wide and he has swatted that for four through cover even as he overbalanced
slower ball, swings and misses
length, wide of off and called wide
length, wide of off, gets it off the toe of the bat between cover and mid-off
yorker on middle, squeezed to mid-on
wide yorker, can't reach it
full and down the legside, called wide
full and straight, drilled to long-off
length outside off, he swings but edged is to Wade behind the stumps
length on the stumps and it's through him and rattled the stumps. Scorchers loose two in two for the second time tonight
the hattrick ball is on a length, cramping him, beaten for pace but gets through for a leg bye
slower ball, outside off, leading edge down to third man
full and wide, swings and misses
full and straight and he has picked that up down the ground
length on middle, swings wildly, gets a bit of an inside edge past short fine for two
full on leg stump, in his arc, he has picked it up again wide of long-on
slower ball outside off and that's the third six of the over, this one dragged over long-on and Scorchers finish with a flourish
full on the pads, worked away to midwicket
full on the stumps, defended back
length on middle, bit of turn and bounce, defended
slower, angled in, driven to long-on
gives himself room, followed him, pushed to long-on
length on off, cut away through point
length outside off, defended to cover
length on middle, goes for the pull, the extra pace hurried him but the top edge sails over the keeper's head
length on off, defended to cover
length on off, goes across and swings but the extra bounce means there's another top edge, which swirled in the air but the midwicket fielder kept his composure and took it easily in the end
length outside off, defended with soft hands and they scamper through for one
length, he walked across and missed the flick and that went over the leg stump
length on middle, cramps him up
length on middle, squeezed to fine-leg off the inside edge
full on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg
length outside off, skips down the wicket and drills it between cover and mid-off
length on the pads, tucked away to fine leg
length outside off, defended to point
full outside off, beaten as he tries to go across the line
short one, angled across, can't get the pull away due to the angle and the pace
length outside off, punched off the backfoot and the timing teases the cover fielder all the way down to the boundary without ever giving him any real chance
length on off, drags the pull to mid-on where the fielder put in a valiant dive but couldn't get a hand
length on off, punched to point
length down the leg side, called wide
length on the pads again, and the deflection takes it past the short fine-leg
length on the legs again, this time clipped to the right of the short fine-leg
length on middle, driven to long-on
slower ball on middle, walks across and chips it over midwicket
length on off, skips down and pushes it to cover
length on off, pushed to mid-off
length ball, looks to muscle it over the top and loses his grip on the bat, spooning it high in the air to cover. The BBl's top scorer goes
full toss on off, pushed to mid-off
length on the legs, moves across and clips it fine
length outside off, beaten as he tries to help it over the keeper
length on middle, lofted over the bowler's head
length on middle, clipped to fine-leg
length on middle, he skips down the track and swings through the line over the bowlers head
length on off, pushed to mid-on
length on middle, he has nailed the pull there but straight down square-leg's throat
length, angled in, defended off the backfoot
full and straight, drilled past the bowler but mid-on cuts it off to his left
length on middle, pushed to long-on
googly on middle, turned around to squareleg
length, spinning away, extra bounce and beaten
full on the legs, clipped to deep squareleg
short ball, pulled hard but straight to deep squareleg
length on middle, scooped to long-on but well short
full and straight, goes through the line, doesn't get all of it but clear of mid-off
length on middle and pulled powerfully over midwicket
length on the hip, helps it to fine-leg
length on off, pushed to cover
length on off, pushed to the left of cover
length ball, advances down the track, the bowler follows him but manages to turn it around to deep squareleg
short on the legs, pulled to deep squareleg
full outside off, drawing him forward, leans in and drives to deep cover
overpitched and lofted over long-on, where a one handed catch is taken by a spectator
short, bit of width, cut away
edged and down to third man for four
length on middle, turned to deep squareleg
full and straight, pushed down the ground without much of a flourish but timed it superbly
length on middle, extra bounce, gets his bottom hand off and defends
full and straight, pushed to mid-off
short and pulled down to deep midwicket
slower ball on off, punched to long-on
short ball, pulled well in front of square but without much timing
short ball, width offered, punched to deep cover
length outside off, spinning away and beaten as he stretches out, dragging his backfoot out in the process, and Bancroft was up to the task of whipping the bails off
full an wide, driven square
length outside off, pushes and is beaten
full and straight, drilled to long-off
length outside off, extra bounce, steered to short third-man
length ball, looks to turn it around to the leg side, closes the face to soon and gets a leading edge which spoons up to cover for a simple catch
length on the pads, nudged to squareleg
length on off, walks across and tries to ramp it around the corner but doesn't get all of it
gives himself room, the bowler follows him but still manages to get it past the left of point
slower ball on middle, pushed down to long-on
short and wide and punched through the covers with a lot of power behind the stroke, beating deep cover
full and straight and he launches him over his head. It was overpitched and in the slot
overpitched on middle, drilled to long-on
full toss, drilled to long-on
short and wide, cut away past point for two
googly, through him, bit of an inside edge and gets four lucky runs there
length on off, moving away a touch, pokes at it tentatively and beaten
length, angled in, clipped away to deep squareleg
full toss, clipped to the right of deep squareleg
short ball, pulled and that is Bailey's 10th BBL fifty
length, angled in, clipped to deep midwicket
length outside off, steered to third-man
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
slower ball on off, can't get it past cover
full outside off and Bailey pierces the gap between cover and mid-off, who were in the circle
slower ball, short in length, nails the pull down to deep midwicket
length on middle, extra bounce and beats Faulkner who made room and tried to steer it to third man
length on middle, makes room again and is beaten trying to steer it to third man again
length on off, he takes him on with the mid-off up but he clears the boundary anyway
length outside off, hammers it to cover, who makes a valuable save with the dive
length on off, drilled to long-off
full and straight, drills it to long-on even though he lost hi shape there
length ball, attempts the pull and is smacked on the grill with that as he took his eyes off it, but they run through for a single
full and wide, can't reach it and called wide
full outside off and he clears cover
length ball, followed him as he made room but drifted too far down the leg
length ball, defended to point after making room and gets through for a run
full toss on the pads, clipped to fine-leg
length outside off, Faulkner made a lot of room, couldn't reach and it was called wide
length, tucking him up but manages to get it away to deep squareleg for one
length on middle, Bailey walks across and attempts the ramp over the keeper even with the fine leg there but only gets the really high part of his bat and it ballooned to the keeper who gobbled it up
short ball, let though
slower ball, bit of width, find the gap between point and short third-man with a delicately late cut
full outside off, charges down the wicket and spoons it over point and they come through for two
length on middle, down the track, swings and misses
short ball, pulls but misses
slower ball, wide off, squeezes it out to deep cover
length outside off, swings and misses but they scamper through for a single
full and wide, drilled to deep cover
length on the legs, Faulkner who has struggled thus far picks this up over deep square-leg
length on middle, picks it between deep midwicket and long-on, placing it perfectly

full and straight and Faulkner has launched this over long-off, suddenly finding the middle of the bat and the boundary when the Hurricanes desperately needed it. And that's the match for the Hurricanes
